title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act may be cited as the "Economic Development Information Act of 1997". It includes findings and declarations. The "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" emphasizes the importance of accurate and timely information on economic development programs for the national economy and regions suffering from unemployment. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have been successful in providing such information. The "Economic Development Information Act of 1997" aims to expand the provision of economic development information to assist areas facing economic distress or long-term deterioration. This information should give access to various government and economic resources in a user-friendly format for development purposes. The Economic Development Information Act of 1997 aims to provide economic development information to areas in need. This includes access to government and economic resources in a user-friendly format. Additionally, Title VI of the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include the creation of an Office of Economic Development Information. The Secretary will establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office will serve as a central information hub for economic development programs, assist applicants in finding and applying for assistance, and create links to information databases from various government agencies. The Office of Economic Development Information will develop electronic links to databases containing information on available economic development programs at the Federal level, including application processes, eligibility criteria, and key contacts. The Office of Economic Development Information provides relevant information on economic development programs, including application processes, eligibility criteria, contact personnel, economic data and trends, case studies, best practices, and technology utilization programs. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources for technology utilization programs, published works related to economic development, revolving loan fund programs, and sources of capital for businesses. Additionally, it offers assistance in pursuing sustainable development initiatives and ensures public access to data services. The Office of Economic Development Information ensures public access to data services through an internet website, toll-free telephone number, and online electronic access. The Office of Economic Development Information provides public access through a toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, orientation materials, workshops, and information specialists for person-to-person assistance. Coordination with other federal departments and agencies is required to achieve the objectives of this section, with economic development defined to include economic adjustment and disaster response. In this section, economic development includes economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for necessary funds.
